item.title: grub-reboot with submenus
item.description: Occasionally it is useful to be able to reboot a machine into an earlier kernel and watching and waiting for the grub menu isn’t always feasible or convenient. The command grub-reboot allows you to set a temporary entry to use for the next reboot; however you need to know the correct input in order for it to work. First, look at /boot/grub/grub.cfg and determine which kernel you want to reboot into.
